meanings.definition: To force (someone) into doing something quickly or unfairly.
meanings.sent1: The teacher railroaded the students into finishing the test in just ten minutes.
meanings.sent2: The manager railroaded the employees into working overtime without proper compensation.
meanings.sent3: The coach railroaded the team into running extra laps as punishment for being late.
meanings.sent4: The strict schedule railroaded the travelers into rushing to catch the train.
meanings.sent5: The strict deadline railroaded the students into completing their project overnight.

meanings.definition: To convict (someone) of a crime unfairly or by using false evidence.
meanings.sent1: The corrupt officials railroaded the innocent man into confessing to a crime he didn't commit.
meanings.sent2: The dishonest prosecutor railroaded the suspect by presenting fabricated evidence in court.
meanings.sent3: The cunning lawyer tried to railroad the defendant by manipulating the witness testimonies.
meanings.sent4: The biased judge railroaded the defendant by ignoring crucial evidence in the case.
meanings.sent5: The planted evidence railroaded the suspect into a wrongful conviction.
